verification.notes: Closed in 2004\. Site of major, persistent arsenic pollution. 47 | Canonical name+slug generated. Web search geocoded. Source: Calculated from Carcassonne (https://www.showcaves.com/english/fr/mines/Salsigne.html). The Salsigne Mine was France's leading gold mine and the world's leading arsenic mine for over a century, closed in 2004

operators: Société des Mines et Produits Chimiques de Salsigne (SMPCS)
Bureau de Recherches Géologiques et Minières (BRGM)
web_search_companies.notes: The mine has changed ownership multiple times and was last operated by an Australian consortium before its closure.
